DLHK Badung Stres Pembuangan Sampah ke TPA Suwung Dibatasi 15 Truk/Hari
06 Nov 2019, 14:55 by Aditya Mardiastuti
Denpasar - Pihak Dinas Lingkungan Hidup dan Kebersihan (DLHK) Badung mengaku pusing tujuh keliling soal kebijakan pembatasan truk yang membuang sampah ke tempat pembuangan akhir (TPA) Suwung, Denpasar, Bali. DLHK Badung mengaku tak siap untuk mengalihkan pembuangan sampah ke lokasi lain.
"Soal Suwung menjadi problem bagi dinas pertama karena badung hanya bisa kuota 15 truk dari biasanya 225 truk/hari, hanya bisa masuk 15 truk itu sampai 29 November 2019 akan datang setelah itu off. Jadi kami harus mengolah sendiri," kata Kadis DLHK Badung I Putu Eka Merthawan saat dihubungi via telepon, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Eka mengatakan pihaknya memang sudah berencana untuk membangun pusat pengolahan sampah mandiri pada 2021. Namun, karena masalah sampah di TPA Suwung ini pihaknya mengaku dibuat kelabakan karena pengolahan sampah itu masih digodok.
"Di satu pihak karena itu amat sangat mendadak kami tidak bisa menangani itu. perencanaan kami 2021 badung mandiri tidak ke TPA lagi, perlu waktu setahun 2020 awal sampai 2021 kita sudah take off. Kalau sekarang kita kan kalang kabut mengolah sampah kan tidak bisa bim salabim," keluhnya.
Pembuangan sampah di TPA Suwung ini dibatasi pasca-kebakaran di kawasan tersebut. Warga setempat bahkan sempat melakukan aksi blokade truk-truk yang membuang sampah.
Aksi itu mengundang perhatian Gubernur Bali Wayan Koster hingga akhirnya disepakati Denpasar masih diizinkan membuang sampah ke lokasi tersebut, namun untuk daerah lain seperti Badung, Tabanan, dan Gianyar tidak diizinkan. Badung sendiri diberi batas waktu satu bulan dengan volume maksimal 15 truk sampah per hari.
"Iya benar kalau kerepotan saya amini, kelimpungan saya amini, kalau kadisnya stres saya amini. Makanya saya harus kerja keras dulu sekarang, apapun caranya kerja keras dulu jadi dalam waktu singkat ya nggak apa-apa kita lagi diuji sama yang di atas. Sedih lihat temen-temen jungkir balik, semua jadi senam aerobik," paparnya.
Untuk sementara, kata Eka, pihaknya menyerahkan pengelolaan sampah ke masing-masing wilayah. Dia mengakui memang ada beberapa wilayah yang sampahnya masih menumpuk, seperti di Legian.
"Kita serahkan ke desa, kelurahan untuk menangani, berbagi sama-sama. Yang jelas kami sudah kompak semua, lurah, camat, kades, untuk bersama-sama kompak," jawab Eka.
Pihaknya juga sedang mengkaji lahan provinsi yang ditawarkan Koster di Ungasan ataupun di Sobangan. Sebab, lahan tempat pembuangan sementara (TPS) itu berdekatan dengan daerah pariwisata.
"Sudah ada banyak bagus-bagus sekali, luas-luas berada di kawasan pariwisata itu problemnya. Cuma kan posisinya yang luas-luas, bagus, posisinya berada di kawasan pariwisata kan tidak mudah jadi banyak kepentingan. Yang jelas ekonomi mengalahkan lingkungan, lingkungan pasti nomor dua. Jadi kami sadar itu, tetapi kami tidak akan menyerah, kami mencari lahan provinsi yang layak dan ramah," jelasnya.
Dia menyebutkan masyarakat setempat masih berpikir tempat pengolahan sampah yang akan dibangun Badung merupakan TPA konvensional. Pihaknya pun masih mengkaji lahan-lahan lain yang proporsional.
"Kita hargai di sana kawasan pariwisata disarankan di tempat lain yang terhindar benturan sosial. Mohon dipertimbangkan lagi, win-winlah, pariwisata jalan, tapi diusahakan cari tempat yang steril," terangnya.

DLHK Badung Stress of Disposing of Garbage into Suwung Landfill is limited to 15 trucks / day
Nov 6 2019, 14:55 by Aditya Mardiastuti
Denpasar - The Badung Environment and Sanitation Department (DLHK) claimed to have a headache about the truck restriction policy that disposes of garbage to the Suwung landfill, Denpasar, Bali. DLHK Badung claimed that he was not ready to divert garbage disposal to another location.
"The problem of Suwung is a problem for the first service because Badung can only have a quota of 15 trucks from 225 trucks / day, it can only enter 15 trucks until 29 November 2019 will come after it is off. So we have to process it ourselves," said Head of DLHK Badung I Putu Eka Merthawan when contacted via telephone, Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Eka said that his party had indeed planned to build an independent waste treatment center in 2021. However, due to the waste problem at the Suwung TPA, he admitted that he had made a loss because the waste processing was still being prepared.
"On the one hand, because it is very, very sudden, we cannot handle it. Our planning for 2021 is not to go to the TPA anymore, it will take a year from 2020 to 2021, we will have taken off. If we are now frantically processing garbage, we cannot bim Salabim , "he complained.
Disposal of waste in the Suwung landfill is limited after the fire in the area. Local residents even had time to take action to blockade trucks that throw garbage.
The action invited the attention of Bali Governor Wayan Koster until finally it was agreed that Denpasar would still be allowed to dispose of waste to the location, but other areas such as Badung, Tabanan, and Gianyar were not permitted. Badung itself was given a time limit of one month with a maximum volume of 15 garbage trucks per day.
"Yes, it is true that my hassles are amini, my confusion is amini, if the stress levels are amini. So I have to work hard now, whatever is the way to work hard so in a short time yes it's okay for us to be tested with the above. Sad see my friends turned upside down, everything became aerobics, "he explained.
For a while, said Eka, his party handed over waste management to each region. He admitted that there were indeed some areas where garbage was still piling up, such as in Legian.
"We leave it to the villages, villages to handle, share together. What is clear is that we are all compact, village heads, sub-district heads, village heads, to get together compactly," Eka answered.
He said he was also reviewing provincial land offered by Koster in Ungasan or in Sobangan. This is because the temporary disposal site (TPS) is adjacent to the tourism area.
"There are already lots of good things, the extent of being in the tourism area is the problem. Only the position of the vast, good, the position of being in the tourism area is not easy so many interests. What is clear is that the economy defeats the environment, the environment is definitely number "So we are aware of that, but we will not give up, we are looking for decent and friendly provincial land," he explained.
He said the local community still thought the waste processing site that would be built by Badung was a conventional landfill. He said he was also still studying other proportional lands.
"We appreciate that the tourism area is recommended somewhere else that avoids social conflicts. Please reconsider, win-win, road tourism, but try to find a sterile place," he explained.
